items.title: The Atlantic’s Court Historian
items.description: Jill Lepore cuts corners in her case against originalism.

items.title: An Upside-Down Case That Originalism Killed Constitutional Amendments
items.description: Jill Lepore refutes her own argument against originalism.

items.title: America in Real Life Must Not Be as Rabid as America Online
items.description: If we honor Charlie Kirk’s legacy of good-faith engagement, we will reflexively step back from the precipice.

items.title: AI Will Destroy Entire Industries, and That’s a Good Thing
items.description: After each wave of innovation, our country has emerged more prosperous and economically capable. This time will be no different.

items.title: Drugmakers Have a Right to Advertise
items.description: The First Amendment applies to commercial speech as well as political speech.
